description: The 2,000-year durability of ancient Roman concrete is attributed to a chemical process called 'hot mixing,' which incorporates microscopic lime clasts into the material.
significance: When cracks develop, these clasts dissolve and recrystallize, effectively self-healing the concrete.

description: The CIA bought titanium from the Soviet Union through shell companies to build the SR-71 Blackbird, the very plane designed to spy on the Soviets.
significance: It represents one of the most ironic logistical feats of the Cold War.

description: In Gabon, Africa, a uranium deposit naturally hit critical mass 1.7 billion years ago, functioning as a self-sustaining fission reactor for millennia.
significance: It is the only known instance of a natural nuclear reactor on Earth.

description: The Turritopsis dohrnii can revert its cells to their earliest form through transdifferentiation, effectively restarting its life cycle.
significance: It is the only known 'immortal' creature, providing unique insights into biological aging.
